headline: Why J.M. Smucker Stock Plummeted This Week
summary: J.M. Smucker is home to a wide array of instantly recognizable food and beverage brands.  Smucker remains a remarkably stable cash generator, but its immense debt load leaves the company at a disadvantage.  Shares of packaged food and beverage giant J.M. Smucker (NYSE: SJM) were down 13% this week as of 2:30 p.m. ET Thursday, according to data provided by S&P Global Market Intelligence.

headline: Sweet snacks leave bitter taste at JM Smucker
summary: The US manufacturer’s $5.6bn acquisition of Twinkies maker Hostess Brands two years ago raised eyebrows at the time. Now Smucker has lowered its expectations.
